metadata.title: CVE-2021-45868 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.15.3, fs/quota/quota_tree.c does not validatethe block number in the quota tree (on disk). This can, for example, leadto a kernel/locking/rwsem.c use-after-free if there is a corrupted quotafile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-97-generic - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-97-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
